Classification of Pylovo Grids

Pylovo is a python tool for low-voltage distribution grid generation.
The package classification provides the utility of finding representative grids for LV-grids
of Germany or a federal state like Bayern.

Overview of the Classification

An overview of the classification steps is provided here:
  • Short Summary of the Classification Steps

Run the Classification

To use this package pylovo needs to be fully set up. Please refer to ../docs_pylovo/installation.
To apply the classification visit this page:
  • Usage
    • Step 1: Configure the classification
    • Step 2: Calculate the Data for Clustering
    • Step 3: Inspect sampling results (optional)
    • Step 4: Inspect grid generation results (optional)
    • Step 5: Inspect grid parameters (optional)
    • Step 6: Choose parameters for clustering
    • Step 7: Choose number of clusters
    • Step 8: Clustering results

How the Classification Works

Here are some more details about which functions are called for the classification steps.
  • Classification Steps
    • Create a Sample Set of PLZ for Clustering
    • Grid Generation for Classification
    • Calculate Parameters for Grids
    • Filter Grids
    • Cluster the Grids
